name: Hotel Liabeny

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed four nights. Our room was clean, modern and good sized. The location is very good. The staff was fine. No complaints. For the money, it is well above average for a Euopean Hotel.
reviews.title: very good deal
Looks a bit unloved and tired from the outside
reviews.text: I have just spent a weekend in Madrid. I didn't stay here (see my review of Senator Gran Via) but I passed this one on the street so I thought I'd mention it doesn't look great from the outside: old, dusty curtains hanging in the window. On the plus side it's in a great location and on a quiet steet.
I was a guest at the Hotel Liabeny from 28 Dec 05 thru 01 Jan 06. It was a terrific choice in several areas. These include:
reviews.title: Great in Several Respects

reviews.text: 1. The location - you can't beat how central this hotel is. It's less than a 5 minute walk from the Metro stops at Sol and Gran Via.
reviews.title: Eh....
Great Hotel!
reviews.text: 2. Room rates - I paid 95 Euros per night for 3 nights booking through the hotel's website. Over the New Years weekend, many hotels in Madrid were increasing their rates for Dec 30 and 31. I had one consistent, reasonable rate for all 3 nights.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!
reviews.text: We checked into the Liabeny after a couple of bumps in the road with another hotel, and were absolute delighted with accommodations. Ended up taking a junior suite for 196 Euros, which was fabulous - marble bath, sitting area, beautiful linens, etc.

description: Being positioned in the centre of Madrid makes visiting the city even more appealing. Everything is just minutes' walk from Hotel Liabeny; Puerta del Sol, Madrid's Gran Vía, museums, monuments, historical sites, etc.
